Package gdi.game.dominion

Class Figure

java.lang.Object
gdi.game.WorldObject
gdi.game.Drawable
gdi.game.sprite.Sprite
gdi.game.map.MapSprite
gdi.game.map.WalkingMapSprite
gdi.game.dominion.WalkingFigure
gdi.game.dominion.Figure
All Implemented Interfaces:
gdi.game.DrawableObject, gdi.game.UpdatableObject
public class Figure extends WalkingFigure
This class represents an animated Figure. It can walk on a game map.
Version:
2.0
Author:
Sven Huprich, Vanessa Klein

  • Constructor Details

    • Figure

      public Figure(BaseGame baseGame, Color color, boolean isNpc)
      Creates a new Figure.
      Parameters:
      baseGame - The game you want to use the figure in.
      color - The color that is used for each owned DominionTile.
      isNpc - false if the figure should be controlled by mouseClicks (human player), true if the figure should be a non-playing character and choose its targets by itself.

  • Method Details

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo(DominionTile tile)
      Lets the figure walk to the given DominionTile.
      Parameters:
      tile - Destination DominionTile the figure should walk to

    • getTile

      public DominionTile getTile()
      Returns the DominionTile below the figure.
      Returns:
      The DominionTile below the figure.

    • getColor

      public Color getColor()
      Returns the color assigned to the figure.
      Returns:
      The color assigned to the figure.

    • isNpc

      public boolean isNpc()
      Returns true if the figure is controlled by the computer.
      Returns:
      -true if non-playing character
      -false if controllable by a human player via mouse clicks

    • getDepartureTime

      public double getDepartureTime()
      Returns the game time in seconds when the figure should start walking again after a pause (see getPauseDuration).
      Returns:
      game time in seconds when the figure should leave its current tile.

    • setDepartureTime

      public void setDepartureTime(double departureTime)
      Sets the departure time when the figure should start walking again after a pause (see getPauseDuration).
      Parameters:
      departureTime - the time in seconds the figure should start walking.

    • isWalking

      public boolean isWalking()
      Returns true if this figure is currently walking.
      Returns:
      true if this figure is currently walking.

    • setPauseDuration

      public void setPauseDuration(double duration)
      Sets duration in seconds that this figure wants to wait after having reached a target tile.

      Use this to adjust difficulty.
      Default=2.0
      Parameters:
      duration - The duration in seconds that this figure wants to wait after having reached a target tile before it starts walking again.

    • getPauseDuration

      public double getPauseDuration()
      Returns the duration in seconds that this figure wants to wait after having reached a target tile.
      Returns:
      The duration in seconds that this figure wants to wait after having reached a target tile before it starts walking again.
